title: How can information technology improve healthcare? - Quora

response.answer_text: Software and internet technology can contribute to better healthcare by helping us achieve: 1. Faster, better and cheaper delivery of healthcare 2. Enhanced Practitioner productivity We need the following to achieve the above goals. 1. Paperless hospitals and clinics - We need technology that will help us reduce/eliminate reliance of papers for clinic/hospital workflow and instead help electronic transmission of information within/outside the hospital in a controlled manner. 2. Central Electronic Health Records (EHR) that can act as a single source of medical data for Practitioners and other healthcare providers - pharmacies, labs - as well as end-consumers 3. Business-to-Business E-Commerce platform for the pharmaceutical trade to enhance efficiency and to interface with customers - Practitioners as well as end-consumers - to procure orders 4. Communication and collaboration platform for the healthcare community - Practitioners, pharmacies, labs - to exchange information among themselves faster, so that the end-consumer benefits by reduced cost and increased speed of delivery. 5. Standardization of diseases and procedures - adoption of standards such as ICD 10 so that the entire healthcare community speaks the same language and reduces ambiguity in communication 6. Virtual Clinics/Hospitals - Facility to exchange information instantly with healthcare providers across geographies to increase speed and efficiency 7. Faster referrals and thereby faster 2nd/3rd opinions All the above requirements aimed at delivering faster, better and cheaper healthcare services are available in HealthLink, an innovative, state-of-the-art, end-to-end, cloud-based software solution. For more details about HealthLink, visit www.healthlink.co.in.

By ‘technology’ I mean Inventions & discoveries made by scientific research process… ok? It may be appreciated that ‘biology’ and its sub-branches have studied various aspects of living beings - anatomy & physiology, details of internal & external organs, nest/home making, reproduction, etc. etc. After this, for the last around 50 years or so, there is NO ADVANCEMENT in the biology. What we see as scientific advancement in healthcare now are efforts to superimpose scientific inventions & discoveries made by Chemistry and Physics and associated sub-branches. The science of biology can develop further so as to “contribute to better healthcare” only if biology can be differentiated from chemistry & physics. For this, one has to understand that ‘healthcare’ is NOT ‘medical care’… cleanliness is NOT anti-septic sterility, etc. And each individual has to take the control of health care requirements in one’s own hands. This is certainly possible with technology developed in biology, but the ‘commercialized’ medical world WOULD NOT ALLOW people to do so, and they would continue to terrify and drug the people, burn &/or remove organs & body parts - many of which are more horrible than the original disease itself.
